headline: Mini Cheesecakes III
description: This recipe makes 6 miniature cheesecakes in muffin cups. Excellent topped with fresh fruit or jelly.
name: Mini Cheesecakes III

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease a 6-cup muffin pan.

In a medium bowl, mix together the graham cracker crumbs, sugar, and margarine with a fork until combined. Measure a rounded tablespoon of the mixture into the bottom of each muffin cup, pressing firmly. Bake in the pre-heated oven for 5 minutes, then remove to cool. Keep the oven on.
Beat together the cream cheese, sugar, lemon juice, lemon zest and vanilla until fluffy. Mix in the egg.

Pour the cream cheese mixture into the muffin cups, filling each until 3/4 full. Bake at 325 degrees F (165 degrees C) for 25 minutes. Cool completely in pan before removing. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

review.reviewBody: So easy to make used a 6‚Äùinch daddyO pan& I added some freeze dried strawberries that I pulverized and it was soo good It tasted like strawberry shortcake crunch ice creamüçìüç∞üç¶üíï
Yummy, I stirred in tiny chocolate chips instead of lemon juice or zest.
Quick and easy recipe turned out great! Delicious!
Good , easy recipe. Was a bit disappointed at how light the cupcakes turned out, but taste was good. Think I will add more lemon zest for color.
They were really good but turned out extremely ugly.

Yum! I did use low fat cream cheese, doubled the recipe because I had to use regular cupcake pan, and we had strawberries on hand I cut up tiny and added powdered sugar and leftover fresh lemon juice of half lemon. Way perfect for Mother‚Äôs Day! Thank you so much for sharing this tasty recipe. Try it with strawberries; will do that part over and over, with this recipe,

I made this Mini Cheesecake today for my Easter dessert tomorrow. The only thing that turns out right. It was the cheesecake. The crust didn't turn out right. As the crust and the cream cheese mixture didn't stick together. I had to bake it the second time for 12 minutes. The first 25 minutes didn't worked. I must have done something wrong. I did follow the Instructions all the way.
Followed the recipe exactly as is. Delicious!!
Very good. Did not use any lemon and just added extra vanilla.

This is my go to recipe for mini cheesecakes now. Love that you only need one package of cream cheese! I have made them several times. I topped them with a homemade blueberry sauce , delicious. Great size for the two of us to enjoy for dessert rather then a full size cheesecake that might go to waste. I only use the lemon juice, not the zest and find the taste is perfect for us.
Delicious! I didn't have lemon zest, but still great. This recipe made 7 miniature cheesecakes in my muffin pan that makes a dozen.

Such good cheesecake!! I was watching Golden Girls and thought their cheesecake looked AMAZING so I made myself some mini ones and these HIT THE SPOT. It‚Äôs so tangy and delicious. I‚Äôd love to make a full cheesecake out of this recipe
I added a bit more sugar to the cheesecake, but easy and delish.
I made them as written but used a silicon muffin pan that I sprayed with canola oil spray. They popped right out and looked beautiful.

It was really good and I liked it with my blackberry recipe on top. the only problem was that it was really hard to take it out of the pan without it crumbling after it cooled. other than that, it was really good.
Incredibly easy to make and perfect size for a tasty nibble. Totally going to experiment with different toppings.
Perfect!

I love this recipe! It makes just enough decadence for a couple, and I can bake it in my toaster oven. I did use chocolate graham crackers for the crust and substituted milk for the lemon juice. I put a few blueberries on top, and it came out great.

I made this recipe.. I followed all the other reviews and omitted the lemon zest and it came out perfect
This is the first cheesecake I ever made that came out perfect wit no cracks

These were amazing! I doubled the recipe to fill a whole muffin tin and I made blueberry sauce to put on top. I gave it 4 stars because the crust did not stick to the rest of the cheesecake. You had to be very careful taking them out of the muffin tin.
Love it. Always double the crust.
Came out delicious! I double the recipe, which was risky, but it worked just fine
Taste wonderful. I don't like to cook, but this was so easy.
Taste wonderful. I don't like to cook, but this was so easy.

I made exactly as written, even picked a fresh lemon off my tree right before making. I did use silicone cupcake containers which worked perfect for cooking and they easily popped out with no sticking or cracking. I do not plan to make it again though since my husband said it just didn't have much flavor. They sure looked cute though.
Could u add condensed milk to the recipe

This recipe is great for 2-4 people dessert. Taste is delicious, I added some sour cherry preserves, very little to the top with a berry, my kids loved it. Great to take to shut-ins or added to a drop off meal. Loved it!

Great! Exactly what I want in a cheesecake. In my opinion the lemon is very subtle and will be especially delicious when I top with raspberries. I doubled the crust because I like crust. I lined the cupcake pan with paper cupcake liners. I baked for 25 minutes, then turned off oven and left them in the oven with door propped open for another 30 minutes. I also placed a bowl of water on the bottom shelf because I heard that is how you keep them from cracking. Mine are perfect, so maybe that is the trick?
I tripled the crust to make 12 cupcakes and doubled the top. it was perfect
Yes, i made it again. It was amazing.
I used chocolate baking crumbs instead of graham wafers and the juice from a full lemon to make them extra zesty!
Really yummy! I brought these into work, and they were a hit! I just used some jam as a fruity topping. I am making these again
Tasted fine, but had to double the amount of crust to only get a very thin layer of crust.

Wonderful recipe! I add twice as much zest for a great lemony flavor, and I swap out Neufchatel for cream cheese for less calories. I also add a big pan of water on the bottom rack for added humidity in the oven to avoid cracks in the cake. Best recipe I've used for cheesecake - hands down!
These were really good, but I overbaked them, and they got a little dry. It‚Äôs definitely a good recipe.
a beautifully creamy delight

I replace Oreo chocolate cookie crumbs instead of Graham crackers. 
It taste much better when I put less sugar than original recipe. 
I also use the baking cups for handling & convenience.
Made it for a family member who is doing the keto diet. I made it without a crust and without sugar ( I used Stevia) and he loved it ! Great fat bomb!
my cakes turned out as shown but I was only able to make 3 cakes not 6. see pic
The only change was I tripled the recipe. Huge hit at a party

Liked this! I didn‚Äôt add any lemon zest, and it wasn‚Äôt too lemony. We did have a problem with it puffing up and then collapsing in, though it‚Äôs likely that‚Äôs my inexperience rather than the recipe. Made these in cupcake pans, the recipe made pretty exactly 8. We added strawberry and chocolate to the top, which improved it. Overall, delicious, and not as heavy as other chresecakes!

I love these. My niece also gets excited about them every time I make them. This is my go to recipe for potlucks, and recently even made them for a bake sale. The only change I make is that I leave out the lemon zest, I am afraid they will taste too much like lemon otherwise. I've never tried them with the zest, but I like it fine without so I just don't bother. When I bake them I also place the cupcake pan in a cookie sheet and add water (about 1-2 inches) - it helps prevent cracking. Just be careful with the hot water when taking out the pan (you can also just use a deeper pan). I also usually chop up some strawberries, sprinkle a bit of sugar on them, stir to coat, let them sit for about 10-15 minutes, and use the strawberries to top of the cupcakes. Delish!
Good tastes and easy to make
Great sooo easy and delish!! It made a total of 9, I used mini graham cracker crust ????
Really great recipe!! I even ended up doubling the batch and making it into a whole cheesecake. (Make the crust in a springform pan the same, and bake batter for 25-30 minutes.)

These are an instant hit! I did make changes. I used regular cupcake liners instead of mini. I sparyed bottom of liner with butter spray and then placed one vanilla lemon wafer with a 1/2 teaspoon vanilla poured over it. I poured the filling over the wafer and baked about 17-20 minutes. Super easy! I bring these to my school pot luck every year and they go very quickly.
I use Vanilla Wafers in the bottom instead of the graham cracker crumbs. Easier, tidier and just as yummy. When the liner is taken off they are easier to eat.

I don't understand why the video was a much different recipe than the actual recipe under the video. This is confusing me to no end. At first, one of the ingredients it said to put in was pork shoulder, and the last ingredient was chicken broth. Can someone explain this to me? And also, Why use the tinfoil? you can bake it without the paper cups as long as you grease the pan.

It was so tasty!! I trippled the recipe because the recipe only makes 6, so I ended up making 18. They were super lemony which was great because i love lemon, and the recipe didn't give the instructons for making the blueberry mint topping so I just did 1 cup fresh blueberries and 1/4 cup white sugar and 1/4 cup lemon juice and it turned out really good. And we put the mint leafs on top too. Very tasty!!! I will make it again!
No changes and I will definitely make it again!
These were way too easy, and way too good. I'm going to get fat. Everybody loved them.

The bottom was very crumbly, and they didn't come out of the pan well, so muffin cups would be needed. I followed other reviews and didn't add the lemon. Before baking, I tried the batter, and was very excited, as it tasted very good. I chilled them, and ate them with my boyfriend for dessert. It no longer tasted good at all! I almost couldn't eat it...was not impressed
very easy and delicious!!!!
What was the chocolate sauce in the pic??
A great option for small families (just two of us), without facing too much left over!
Made it with lemon zest and juice. No topping, since I made it for a friend in the hospital who could only eat thick creamy items. Very tasty.
Turns out wonderfully if you bake in muffin tins in a water bath.
Really good and easy.
The crust was a little disappointing and would have added more sugar and butter...it fell apart too easily. Guests loved it.
This was easy and great tasting even for a rookie. I used a 6 inch springform pan instead of muffin tin. I topped it off with a blueberry coulis. I will definitely make it again....
Super easy recipe. I doubled it and made 12 mini cupcakes. I only omitted the lemon zest. I sliced up fresh cherries and made a cherry sauce for the top. Delish!
Very delicious! I made it for fun and it was a huge hit with my family. This is the perfect amount of lemon. I suggest eating it with some jam on top, (raspberry is my favorite).
HIGHLY recommend. Made for hubby's bday. Hubby: I wasn't sure who was more talented [in the kitchen], you or me. But now, with these cakes, I'm sure it's you.

This was an unmitigated disaster. 

The filling was yummy (I changed the flavoring), but...I had to make a second batch of crust mixture to cover the bottom of each cup even very thinly, and every last smidgen of the filling filled only 1/4 of each cup. When I checked the cook at 15 minutes, the cheesecakes were already burnt and starting to smoke.

Is it possible that the author meant for us to fill only 6 cups of a regular-size, 12-cup tin? I have tins for mini, maxi, and regular-size muffins; the only 6-cup tin is the maxi size, so that's what I used...

Regardless, I won't be making this again. My regular cake-size cheesecakes are loved by all, so that's what I'll stick to from now on.

These are delicious. I added a TBSP of strawberry jam to the center of each and swirled the jam into the cheesecake. They turned out great. Only thing is, they were not cooked at 25 minutes and I left them in for another 10 minutes and still not done and then for an additional 10 minutes and they were golden on top. I think the extra cook time was due to the jam and I think if I hadn't opened the oven 2 times to check them it wouldn't have taken as long either. I am going to try for 35 minutes next time I make them without opening the oven at 25 minutes to see if that works.
I think that these are absolutely delicious and extremely easy to make! Yum Yum Yum!

I used foil cupcake liners and instead of a graham cracker crumb crust, placed one vanilla wafer in the bottom before the cheesecake filling. My mom made them like that when we were kids and it makes them really easy.
Ppapppppppppppppppppppp

Very good mini cheesecake! My family really enjoyed this. I made my own tweaks. I replaced the sugar with Swerve (erythritol) and used chocolate graham crackers for the crust. Served them upside down with the crust on top. Tasted even better when left in the fridge overnight. Had the perfect texture then.

I loved that this recipe was scaled down. I followed it exactly. My cupcakes did crack but as they cooled the crack diminished and was not even noticeable. My hubby loved them and I will make them again.
really grease the muffin tin so they come out clean
Proper and beautiful Display of ingredients and combination.
I made a huge mistake of using a paper lining and so the crust got totally stuck to the lining! But the taste is fabulous!!

This recipe was so simple and so delicious! Baking the crust before adding the mixture really adds the perfect texture! Also, I added the lemon juice but skipped the zest so that the taste wasn't so singular. I made several batches and had fun with the toppings as well. I tried apple pie filling topped with chopped pecans and the usual cherry pie filling. I even added some chocolate syrup to one of the batches and topping it off with raspberry filling. This was a hit after Christmas dinner!

This recipe was so simple and so delicious! Baking the crust before adding the mixture really adds the perfect texture! Also, I added the lemon juice but skipped the zest so that the taste wasn't so singular. I made several batches and had fun with the toppings as well. I tried apple pie filling topped with chopped pecans and the usual cherry pie filling. I even added some chocolate syrup to one of the batches and topping it off with raspberry filling. This was a hit after Christmas dinner!

These were OK. I guess they hit the spot if you're craving cheesecake but don't actually want to make one. They tasted better the next day, cold from the refrigerator. I might make them again if I'm feeling particularly lazy, but not because of flavor.

Delicious! I followed the recipe exactly the first time. The second time, I omitted the lemon, doubled the vanilla, and added two tablespoons of sour cream and a teaspoon of flour (per another reviewer's suggestion). Every bit as yummy and perfect as the original recipe. So much quicker and easier than a standard NY style cheesecake. Thanks!

This is the best cheesecake recipe, easy, delicious, made it for an after school treat for my 15 year old grandson, and the next night made it again...its a fast recipe, and it will be gobbled up quickly, so double the recipe.

I used this recipe with a mini muffin pan. I tripled the mix for the crust and piped the cheesecake filling into 24 mini muffins. I baked the crust for 5 min like the recipe calls for and the cheesecakes for 20 min instead of 25. I wanted to make a 2-bite sized cheesecake and it worked out very well. Only problem is, I have to be careful not to eat 5 or 6 of them at a time. Yummy;)
It was really good. Different from the recipe I normally use. I love the citrus flavor from the lemon juice. This will be my new go to recipe for cheesecake.

These were AMAZING. Loved them!!! The only change I made was I didn't add the lemon juice or zest. These were easy to make and came out perfect. I see a lot of others saying what liners they used, so Iwill say that I used silicone liners, and the bake time was the same, no cracking. They were perfect!

I've never made cheese cake before but after reviewing a bunch of recipes, this one had similar ratios to many others... so I tried it. 

I made 2 1/2 dozen mini ones in a mini muffin pan with paper liners. Since I was looking for a Fall flavor, I opted to use a drizzle of maple syrup rather then the lemon and I topped them with a salted caramel apple compote I whipped up... yummy.

I baked them for 15mins in a regular oven (not convection) with a water bath (I saw others use it from other recipes) They turned out perfect! No cracking, they set well- I will make them again.
Loved it! Easy, fast, delicious!
No it's Perfect The Way they are!
I loved this recipe! It was easy to follow. I added a pur√©ed strawberry filling that really helped with lemon taste that other reviews mentioned.
I love this recipe and so did my family!!

These small cheesecakes are really good and easy to make. They are the perfect size for dessert or a quick snack. I used a silicone cupcake pan and put a pan of water underneath. No cracking, but I don't think we would care anyway. I always make a double batch, they are gone in no time.

I made a double batch and my daughter is begging for more. I didn't have a fresh lemon in the house so I used bottled lemon juice and skipped the zest. I also added 1/4 cup of sour cream because I gives it a very creamy texture. I will be making these over and over

I was always afraid to mess up a full cheesecake, so I always bought Royale No Bake (now discontinued). The Jello is not as good and has become too expensive, so I was really happy with the results of these. Did I change anything? Just a squeeze of lemon seemed enough for my tastes and I doubled the crust... never too much graham cracker crust ;)

This recipe is delicious! The only changes I made were: 
1.) adding a tablespoon more butter to the crust and NOT baking it prior to adding the filling 
2.) I didn't use lemon zest & did use fresh squeezed lemon juice 
3.) I used a large ice cream scooper to fill each cupcake liner almost to the top 
4.) They needed to bake for 19 minutes & came out perfectly - no cracks & incredibly moist! 
5.) I added a dollop of cherry pie filling to the center of each. (Even with filling each so full, after baking, there was a slight indentation on top to hold it perfectly.) 
6.) I made two quadruple recipes (8 x's the recipe) and it made 7 dozen

Absolutely delicious. The only problem I had was the crust didn't bind well. I think it needed a little more butter. The lemon flavor really stands out and gives it a different taste. We personally liked the lemony taste. The size is perfect for dessert and I topped it off with a strawberry. We all loved it!!!
Removed the lemon completely and doubled the vanilla and they were amazing!!!! It tasted just like a NY cheesecake.
Easy to follow and turn out great. Will try again.
I didn't add the lemon zest.

I really liked it. I didn't chill it long enough, but I still thought it was very good. It was easy to make and looked kinda elegant once the toppings were on. I didn't know that they would indent so much, but my mom said that's how it's suppose to be. Once the toppings were on, it was really pretty! I did cherries on top and really awesome lemon curd on the other!!

This is a superior recipe. I'm not a good baker whatsoever. I followed all the directions to the point and I did leave out the lemon zest. This came out spectacular and I am so surprised!! Bottom line leave out the lemon zest and make sure you cool down your cupcake. Put it in the refrigerator after it's done. Add a little almonds or graham cracker or fruit good nosh you will be one happy camper

I'm not a very good baker so the fact that I was able to make this successfully proves how easy it is to make! I followed the recipe as it is, except I doubled the amount so I can fill up a whole cupcake pan and I had to cook it longer in our old oven. If you love lemon, you will love this cheesecake as you can really taste it, otherwise, just omit the lemon zest and juice. This is a very good base recipe, I think next time I'll try it with crushed oreos instead. :)
They are so simple and so good! I will definitely make them again.

I make these as mini cheesecakes, same recipe except I don't use the lemon or lemon zest, just a little bit more vanilla. Make sure you do a bain marie for this and then there is no cracking of the cheesecakes. Drizzle some melted chocolate and yum!
